content.rendered:
Our families play an important role in the success of our students. Below are links to key areas of the website and helpful resources. School-specific information and school handbooks may be found on building web pages.

View the SSCSD Family Welcome Packet in English.

View the SSCSD Family Welcome Packet in Spanish.

Community Events and Information

Visit the community events and information page often for activities, events, summer camps, and more.

Community Resource Guide

Check out the community resource guide organizations and services available to our school community.

Family Mentor Program

Having a connection at a new school helps families feel welcome and excited to be a part of our school community. The goal of the Family Welcome Program is to pair a current family member with a new family that has moved into the school district. Mentor families serve as a point of contact for questions and are also a familiar face at school events. If you are interested, please fill out the Family Mentor Request Form.

Student Registration

Click here for new student registration and attendance zone information.

 It is important to provide the district with up-to-date contact information so please be sure to use the Change of Information form as needed throughout the school year. 

ParentSquare

ParentSquare is a unified communications platform that provides a safe way for teachers, staff, and families to communicate, all in one place! We encourage all families to activate their ParentSquare account using your contact information on file with the district.

Sign in to ParentSquare from a web browser or download the ParentSquare mobile app to choose whether to receive push notifications, get automatic language translations for messages, and more. Download in iOS here, or download in Android here.   Click here for help using Parent Square.

School Breakfast and Lunch

School Meal Menus  

Every student will receive one free breakfast and lunch for the 2024-2025 school year.  If you would like to add funds to a meal payment account for your student for other items, visit the LINQ Connect website OR send a check into your child’s school building. Visit the Food Services Department page for more information

SchoolTool

SSCSD uses SchoolTool as its student management system for parents and guardians to access their child(ren)’s grades, attendance, schedule, and other data.

SchoolTool Login Link – The login link is now the same for students, families, and staff.  Parents/guardians and students may also utilize the  SchoolTool Mobile App  to see information about student schedules, assignments, and attendance. 

Student ID Replacement

All students are issued a student ID free of charge at the beginning of every school year.  Student IDs are required to ride a school bus and purchase items in the cafeteria.  If a child loses their student ID, a replacement can be ordered through MySchoolBucks.com. The cost of a replacement student ID is $5.00.  The cost of a replacement ID for a student who is eligible to receive free or reduced-price meals is $1.00. 

 Directions: 

  1. Go to myschoolbucks.com and click Sign-Up
  2. Visit the District’s School Store and add the ID to your cart 
  3. Checkout with your credit/debit card
  4. At the elementary level, a new student ID will be printed by the Transportation Department and sent to a child’s classroom teacher and at the secondary level the new student ID will be available in the main office.

Technology Support

Click here for tech links, forms, and resources.

My Ride K-12 Bus Schedules

My Ride K-12 is our online student transportation portal that enables parents / guardians to access their student’s transportation information and bus schedules. Your login is your student’s ID number.  The SSCSD Transportation Department encourages all families and students to continuously check the application as changes are made daily to all bus routes.  More information about My Ride K-12.
